enb_long_title: Twenty-Fourth sessions of the Subsidiary Body for Scientific and Technological Advice (SBSTA) and the Subsidiary Body for Implementation (SBI) of the UNFCCC and First session of the Ad Hoc Working Group on Further Commitments for Annex I Parties under the Kyoto Protocol (AWG) and related meetings
sentences: The G-77/CHINA stressed implementation, capacity building and economic and market barriers.
CANADA underscored public-private partnerships, synergies, and considering technology issues in the UNFCCC Dialogue and the AWG.
CHINA and UGANDA urged distinguishing between normal market practice and incentives for technology transfer.
Parties will meet informally on Monday.
